definition[0]: to join together the two sides of a coat, shirt, bag etc so that it is closed
example[0]: ‘I’m going now, ’ she said, fastening her coat.
definition[1]: to become joined together with buttons, hooks etc
example[2]: I was so fat that my skirt wouldn’t fasten.
definition[2]: to firmly close a window, gate etc so that it will not open, or to become firmly closed
example[3]: Make sure all the windows are securely fastened before you leave.
definition[3]: to attach something firmly to another object or surface
example[4]: Fasten the edges of the cloth together with pins.
example[5]: They fastened the rope to a tree.
definition[4]: to hold something firmly with your hands, legs, arms, or teeth
example[6]: She fastened her arms around his neck.
example[7]: A strong hand fastened round her wrist.
example[8]: Their long claws allow them to fasten onto the rocks and hold firm.
explanation[0]: Fasten belongs to a group of verbs where the same noun can be the subject of the verb or its object
explanation[1]: In this sentence, ‘the dress’ is the object of fasten
example[9]: You fasten the dress at the back
explanation[2]: In this sentence, ‘the dress’ is the subject of fasten
example[10]: The dress fastens at the back
definition[5]: to join together the two sides of a piece of clothing, bag, belt etc
example[11]: He fastened the necklace behind her neck.
definition[6]: to fasten something firmly to another object or surface, using screws, nails, tape, glue etc
example[12]: The boards were attached with screws.
example[13]: The prisoner was attached to the wall with chains.
definition[7]: to connect or fasten things together
example[14]: Join the pieces using a strong glue
definition[8]: to join things together using glue
example[15]: Glue the fabric to the white card.
example[16]: The students’ name cards were taped to the table.
definition[10]: to fasten something using staples  (=a small piece of wire that is pressed through paper using a special machine)
example[17]: Don’t staple your résumé to your cover letter.
definition[11]: to fasten things together using a clip  (=a small metal object)
example[18]: A photo was clipped to the letter.
definition[12]: to fasten a tie, shoelaces etc by making a knot
example[19]: Don’t forget to tie your shoelaces!
definition[13]: to fasten a piece of clothing or the buttons etc on it
example[20]: The teacher doesn’t have time to do up every child’s coat.
example[21]: Let me do it up for you.
definition[14]: to fasten a shirt, coat etc with buttons
example[22]: His shirt was buttoned right to the top.
definition[15]: to fasten a piece of clothing, a bag etc with a zip
example[23]: Zip up your jacket, it’s cold.
definition[16]: to fasten a seat belt, belt, shoe etc that has a buckle (=small metal object that fits through a hole in a strap)
example[24]: The little girl struggled to buckle her shoes.
definition[17]: to open something that is fastened
example[25]: Do not unfasten your seat belt until the car has stopped completely.
